page.title: 14THE PUBS IN THE AREA 2
page.content: The 'White Horse', Heath Hill, Lawley, has been a public house about 250 years. At one time, like most pubs it brewed its own beer, but today serves 'M & B' beer. A former coaching inn, being on the old turnpike road from Wellington to Ironbridge, it has its highway legend that 'Dick Turpin stopped here'. It is fiercely local in its clientele, with darts on Monday, Thursday, and Friday; dominoes on Wednesday and Friday; pool on Tuesday and Thursday; and runs a football team in the third division of the Telford Sunday League. The 'Foresters Arms', Horsehay, is likewise the sight of an old coaching inn. The name is significant, 'Kelly's Directories' show that before the First World War, Lord Forester owned most of the land in this area. The 'Travellers Joy', like the 'Foresters' runs darts, pool,
